00121 #define EVP_RC2_KEY_SIZE        16

00150 #define EVP_PK_RSA  0x0001
00151 #define EVP_PK_DSA  0x0002
00152 #define EVP_PK_DH   0x0004
00153 #define EVP_PKT_SIGN    0x0010
00154 #define EVP_PKT_ENC 0x0020
00155 #define EVP_PKT_EXCH    0x0040
00156 #define EVP_PKS_RSA 0x0100
00157 #define EVP_PKS_DSA 0x0200
00158 #define EVP_PKT_EXP 0x1000 /* <= 512 bit key */

00174 /* Type needs to be a bit field
00175  * Sub-type needs to be for variations on the method, as in, can it do
00176  * arbitrary encryption.... */
00177 struct evp_pkey_st
00178     {
00179     int type;
00180     int save_type;
00181     int references;
00182     union   {
00183         char *ptr;
00184 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_RSA
00185         struct rsa_st *rsa; /* RSA */
00186 #endif
00187 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_DSA
00188         struct dsa_st *dsa; /* DSA */
00189 #endif
00190 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_DH
00191         struct dh_st *dh;   /* DH */
00192 #endif
00193         } pkey;
00194     int save_parameters;
00195     STACK_OF(X509_ATTRIBUTE) *attributes; /* [ 0 ] */
00196     } /* EVP_PKEY */;
00197 
00198 #define EVP_PKEY_MO_SIGN    0x0001
00199 #define EVP_PKEY_MO_VERIFY  0x0002
00200 #define EVP_PKEY_MO_ENCRYPT 0x0004
00201 #define EVP_PKEY_MO_DECRYPT 0x0008
00202 
00203 #if 0
00204 /* This structure is required to tie the message digest and signing together.
00205  * The lookup can be done by md/pkey_method, oid, oid/pkey_method, or
00206  * oid, md and pkey.
00207  * This is required because for various smart-card perform the digest and
00208  * signing/verification on-board.  To handle this case, the specific
00209  * EVP_MD and EVP_PKEY_METHODs need to be closely associated.
00210  * When a PKEY is created, it will have a EVP_PKEY_METHOD associated with it.
00211  * This can either be software or a token to provide the required low level
00212  * routines.
00213  */
00214 typedef struct evp_pkey_md_st
00215     {
00216     int oid;
00217     EVP_MD *md;
00218     EVP_PKEY_METHOD *pkey;
00219     } EVP_PKEY_MD;
00220 
00221 #define EVP_rsa_md2() \
00222         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_md2WithRSAEncryption,\
00223             EVP_rsa_pkcs1(),EVP_md2())
00224 #define EVP_rsa_md5() \
00225         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_md5WithRSAEncryption,\
00226             EVP_rsa_pkcs1(),EVP_md5())
00227 #define EVP_rsa_sha0() \
00228         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_shaWithRSAEncryption,\
00229             EVP_rsa_pkcs1(),EVP_sha())
00230 #define EVP_rsa_sha1() \
00231         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_sha1WithRSAEncryption,\
00232             EVP_rsa_pkcs1(),EVP_sha1())
00233 #define EVP_rsa_ripemd160() \
00234         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_ripemd160WithRSA,\
00235             EVP_rsa_pkcs1(),EVP_ripemd160())
00236 #define EVP_rsa_mdc2() \
00237         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_mdc2WithRSA,\
00238             EVP_rsa_octet_string(),EVP_mdc2())
00239 #define EVP_dsa_sha() \
00240         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_dsaWithSHA,\
00241             EVP_dsa(),EVP_sha())
00242 #define EVP_dsa_sha1() \
00243         EVP_PKEY_MD_add(NID_dsaWithSHA1,\
00244             EVP_dsa(),EVP_sha1())
00245 
00246 typedef struct evp_pkey_method_st
00247     {
00248     char *name;
00249     int flags;
00250     int type;       /* RSA, DSA, an SSLeay specific constant */
00251     int oid;        /* For the pub-key type */
00252     int encrypt_oid;    /* pub/priv key encryption */
00253 
00254     int (*sign)();
00255     int (*verify)();
00256     struct  {
00257         int (*set)();   /* get and/or set the underlying type */
00258         int (*get)();
00259         int (*encrypt)();
00260         int (*decrypt)();
00261         int (*i2d)();
00262         int (*d2i)();
00263         int (*dup)();
00264         } pub,priv;
00265     int (*set_asn1_parameters)();
00266     int (*get_asn1_parameters)();
00267     } EVP_PKEY_METHOD;
00268 #endif

00270 #ifndef EVP_MD
00271 struct env_md_st
00272     {
00273     int type;
00274     int pkey_type;
00275     int md_size;
00276     unsigned long flags;
00277     int (*init)(EVP_MD_CTX *ctx);
00278     int (*update)(EVP_MD_CTX *ctx,const void *data,unsigned long count);
00279     int (*final)(EVP_MD_CTX *ctx,unsigned char *md);
00280     int (*copy)(EVP_MD_CTX *to,const EVP_MD_CTX *from);
00281     int (*cleanup)(EVP_MD_CTX *ctx);
00282 
00283     /* FIXME: prototype these some day */
00284     int (*sign)();
00285     int (*verify)();
00286     int required_pkey_type[5]; /*EVP_PKEY_xxx */
00287     int block_size;
00288     int ctx_size; /* how big does the ctx->md_data need to be */
00289     } /* EVP_MD */;
00290 
00291 #define EVP_MD_FLAG_ONESHOT 0x0001 /* digest can only handle a single
00292                     * block */
00293 
00294 #define EVP_PKEY_NULL_method    NULL,NULL,{0,0,0,0}
00295 
00296 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_DSA
00297 #define EVP_PKEY_DSA_method DSA_sign,DSA_verify, \
00298                 {EVP_PKEY_DSA,EVP_PKEY_DSA2,EVP_PKEY_DSA3, \
00299                     EVP_PKEY_DSA4,0}
00300 #else
00301 #define EVP_PKEY_DSA_method EVP_PKEY_NULL_method
00302 #endif
00303 
00304 #ifndef OPENSSL_NO_RSA
00305 #define EVP_PKEY_RSA_method RSA_sign,RSA_verify, \
00306                 {EVP_PKEY_RSA,EVP_PKEY_RSA2,0,0}
00307 #define EVP_PKEY_RSA_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_method \
00308                 RSA_sign_ASN1_OCTET_STRING, \
00309                 RSA_verify_ASN1_OCTET_STRING, \
00310                 {EVP_PKEY_RSA,EVP_PKEY_RSA2,0,0}
00311 #else
00312 #define EVP_PKEY_RSA_method EVP_PKEY_NULL_method
00313 #define EVP_PKEY_RSA_ASN1_OCTET_STRING_method EVP_PKEY_NULL_method
00314 #endif
00315 
00316 #endif /* !EVP_MD */

00318 #define HMAC_MULTICORE 
00319 struct env_md_ctx_st
00320     {
00321     const EVP_MD *digest;
00322     ENGINE *engine; /* functional reference if 'digest' is ENGINE-provided */
00323     unsigned long flags;
00324 #ifndef HMAC_MULTICORE 
00325     void *md_data;
00326 #else
00327   /*  Increased from 128 to 256 inorder to make it
00328       work with SHA2 algos */
00329   unsigned char md_data[256];
00330 #endif
00331     } /* EVP_MD_CTX */;
00332 
00333 /* values for EVP_MD_CTX flags */
00334 
00335 #define EVP_MD_CTX_FLAG_ONESHOT     0x0001 /* digest update will be called
00336                         * once only */
00337 #define EVP_MD_CTX_FLAG_CLEANED     0x0002 /* context has already been
00338                         * cleaned */
00339 #define EVP_MD_CTX_FLAG_REUSE       0x0004 /* Don't free up ctx->md_data
00340                         * in EVP_MD_CTX_cleanup */
00341 
00342 struct evp_cipher_st
00343     {
00344     int nid;
00345     int block_size;
00346     int key_len;        /* Default value for variable length ciphers */
00347     int iv_len;
00348     unsigned long flags;    /* Various flags */
00349     int (*init)(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, const unsigned char *key,
00350             const unsigned char *iv, int enc);  /* init key */
00351     int (*do_cipher)(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *ctx, unsigned char *out,
00352              const unsigned char *in, unsigned int inl);/* encrypt/decrypt data */
00353     int (*cleanup)(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *); /* cleanup ctx */
00354     int ctx_size;       /* how big ctx->cipher_data needs to be */
00355     int (*set_asn1_parameters)(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *, ASN1_TYPE *); /* Populate a ASN1_TYPE with parameters */
00356     int (*get_asn1_parameters)(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *, ASN1_TYPE *); /* Get parameters from a ASN1_TYPE */
00357     int (*ctrl)(EVP_CIPHER_CTX *, int type, int arg, void *ptr); /* Miscellaneous operations */
00358     void *app_data;     /* Application data */
00359     } /* EVP_CIPHER */;
00360 
00361 /* Values for cipher flags */
00362 
00363 /* Modes for ciphers */
00364 
00365 #define     EVP_CIPH_STREAM_CIPHER      0x0
00366 #define     EVP_CIPH_ECB_MODE       0x1
00367 #define     EVP_CIPH_CBC_MODE       0x2
00368 #define     EVP_CIPH_CFB_MODE       0x3
00369 #define     EVP_CIPH_OFB_MODE       0x4
00370 #define     EVP_CIPH_MODE           0x7
00371 /* Set if variable length cipher */
00372 #define     EVP_CIPH_VARIABLE_LENGTH    0x8
00373 /* Set if the iv handling should be done by the cipher itself */
00374 #define     EVP_CIPH_CUSTOM_IV      0x10
00375 /* Set if the cipher's init() function should be called if key is NULL */
00376 #define     EVP_CIPH_ALWAYS_CALL_INIT   0x20
00377 /* Call ctrl() to init cipher parameters */
00378 #define     EVP_CIPH_CTRL_INIT      0x40
00379 /* Don't use standard key length function */
00380 #define     EVP_CIPH_CUSTOM_KEY_LENGTH  0x80
00381 /* Don't use standard block padding */
00382 #define     EVP_CIPH_NO_PADDING     0x100
00383 
00384 /* ctrl() values */
00385 
00386 #define     EVP_CTRL_INIT           0x0
00387 #define     EVP_CTRL_SET_KEY_LENGTH     0x1
00388 #define     EVP_CTRL_GET_RC2_KEY_BITS   0x2
00389 #define     EVP_CTRL_SET_RC2_KEY_BITS   0x3
00390 #define     EVP_CTRL_GET_RC5_ROUNDS     0x4
00391 #define     EVP_CTRL_SET_RC5_ROUNDS     0x5
00392 
00393 typedef struct evp_cipher_info_st
00394     {
00395     const EVP_CIPHER *cipher;
00396     unsigned char iv[EVP_MAX_IV_LENGTH];
00397     } EVP_CIPHER_INFO;
00398 
00399 struct evp_cipher_ctx_st
00400     {
00401     const EVP_CIPHER *cipher;
00402     ENGINE *engine; /* functional reference if 'cipher' is ENGINE-provided */
00403     int encrypt;        /* encrypt or decrypt */
00404     int buf_len;        /* number we have left */
00405 
00406     unsigned char  oiv[EVP_MAX_IV_LENGTH];  /* original iv */
00407     unsigned char  iv[EVP_MAX_IV_LENGTH];   /* working iv */
00408     unsigned char buf[EVP_MAX_BLOCK_LENGTH];/* saved partial block */
00409     int num;                /* used by cfb/ofb mode */
00410 
00411     void *app_data;     /* application stuff */
00412     int key_len;        /* May change for variable length cipher */
00413     unsigned long flags;    /* Various flags */
00414     void *cipher_data; /* per EVP data */
00415     int final_used;
00416     int block_mask;
00417     unsigned char final[EVP_MAX_BLOCK_LENGTH];/* possible final block */
00418     } /* EVP_CIPHER_CTX */;
00419 
00420 typedef struct evp_Encode_Ctx_st
00421     {
00422     int num;    /* number saved in a partial encode/decode */
00423     int length; /* The length is either the output line length
00424              * (in input bytes) or the shortest input line
00425              * length that is ok.  Once decoding begins,
00426              * the length is adjusted up each time a longer
00427              * line is decoded */
00428     unsigned char enc_data[80]; /* data to encode */
00429     int line_num;   /* number read on current line */
00430     int expect_nl;
00431     } EVP_ENCODE_CTX;
00432

00435         ASN1_TYPE *param, const EVP_CIPHER *cipher,
00436                 const EVP_MD *md, int en_de);

00487 #define EVP_CIPHER_CTX_flags(e)     ((e)->cipher->flags)
00488 #define EVP_CIPHER_CTX_mode(e)      ((e)->cipher->flags & EVP_CIPH_MODE)

00497 #define EVP_VerifyInit(a,b)     EVP_DigestInit(a,b)

00504 #else

00508 #define BIO_get_md_ctx(b,mdcp)     BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_GET_MD_CTX,0,(char *)mdcp)

00510 #define BIO_get_cipher_ctx(b,c_pp)  BIO_ctrl(b,BIO_C_GET_CIPHER_CTX,0,(char *)c_pp)
00511 
00512 #define EVP_Cipher(c,o,i,l) (c)->cipher->do_cipher((c),(o),(i),(l))

00514 #define EVP_add_cipher_alias(n,alias) \
00515     OBJ_NAME_add((alias),OBJ_NAME_TYPE_CIPHER_METH|OBJ_NAME_ALIAS,(n))
00516 #define EVP_add_digest_alias(n,alias) \
00517     OBJ_NAME_add((alias),OBJ_NAME_TYPE_MD_METH|OBJ_NAME_ALIAS,(n))
00518 #define EVP_delete_cipher_alias(alias) \
00519     OBJ_NAME_remove(alias,OBJ_NAME_TYPE_CIPHER_METH|OBJ_NAME_ALIAS);
00520 #define EVP_delete_digest_alias(alias) \
00521     OBJ_NAME_remove(alias,OBJ_NAME_TYPE_MD_METH|OBJ_NAME_ALIAS);
